summary: The Presidential Allowance Modernization Act of 2025 amends the Former Presidents Act of 1958. It increases the annual annuity and monetary allowance for former presidents to $200,000, subject to certain conditions. It also modifies allowances for surviving spouses of former presidents, increases their allowance and extends coverage to widowers. The bill includes provisions for cost-of-living increases, limitations based on income, and disclosure requirements regarding former presidents' finances. It clarifies that the changes do not impact security provisions or related funding and are not retroactive.
